abstracts.cdata!:
Project outcome is rated satisfactory
            while project sustainability is likely. Overall World Bank
            and Borrower performances were satisfactory. Lessons learned
            included the following: Poverty-focused social service
            delivery projects should be increasingly targeted at the
            township rather than the county level. As provinces and
            counties which have benefited from IDA and IBRD financing
            have to repay the credits and loans, and most likely from
            provincial and county education budgets, caution must be
            taken in the design of future poverty-focused education
            projects to fully consider not only the assumed counterpart
            obligations, but also the future repayment responsibilities
            when calculating project sustainability. The key issue in
            developing education projects at the provincial, county, and
            township levels is to convince the Chinese preparation teams
            that focusing on development outcomes is more important than
            emphasis on investment inputs. Project preparation teams
            must be diligent in working with the Borrower to obtain
            agreement on educational outcome indicators during the
            earliest stages of project design. Establishing experts
            panel with a broad range of educational skills from the
            start of the targeting exercise ensures the project of some
            balance in educational, financial, and staffing needs.
            Teacher and staff training components have been chronically
            weak in Bank-supported basic education projects. Language of
            instruction issues in minority language areas are important.
